name: Gibbon Bridge Hotel

reviews.text: We have been here a couple of times for a meal - the standard of food is excellent - the grounds are wonderful. The venue is stunning - shame its not nearer to Sheffield. If your thinking of a wedding try this place.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is set in a lovely quiet area and the gardens are beautiful.
reviews.title: Country hotel in a beautiful location.

reviews.text: I stayed in room no.1 which was a newly furnished, split level suite which had a lounge area down a few stairs with a lovely view of the gardens.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea a little bit special

reviews.text: The bathroom was a good size with a jacuzzi bath/shower and a leather armchair.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: The rest of the hotel is typically country style with lots of dark wood and figurines over fireplaces.
reviews.title: wet weekend
An other lunch on a very wet day
reviews.text: The four of us decided to book a lunch at the Gibbon Bridge in the summer! As we had previously only had Christmas dinner over the years. The Tuesday we visited was quite with only 13 others in the dining room. The staff were as attentive as always, and it was a pleasure to sit, be fed and watch the rains fall in the wonderful gardens.
The menu was great and the food to die for, and not too expensive considering the quality and quanity.
reviews.title: Disappointing decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had enjoyed a meal at the hotel several years ago, and I remembered the lovely grounds and setting of the place. However whilst attending a wedding there last weekend, I was disappointed by the standard of the room. Set on 2 levels with the bathroom on the lower level, it did not work for me. The standard of decor was also left wanting. Given the price of B&B at £140 I felt that it was far too expensive, without a discount for wedding guests! The food was quite good though, but drinks were expensive.
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here for a night for our friends wedding. The food for the wedding breakfast was lovely. They served bacon buttys and chips for evening buffet, although we had to try and hunt them down as they were walking around with them rather than having it set out. Drinks were exoensive, but to be honest where isnt when its a wedding venue?! Staff were friendly. Everywhere was clean and tidy. The room we were given to stay in was one of the rooms for wheelchair users I think, with allocated parking outside the room. The room itself was very spacious with a sitting area, and flat screen tele on the wall. Bathroom was lovely and modern with underfloor heating and a huge walk in shower. Lovely place and would love to stop again.
reviews.title: A gem in the Trough of Boland

reviews.text: We have stayed twice now in this lovely hotel: the first time on return to Scotland from the south of England and a special 2 day Spring treat was our second visit. Neither disappointed. It is ideally located to break the journey from south to north but is also a delightfully comfortable spot to enjoy the beautiful countryside in any season. Our rooms on both occasion were large and spacious. The sitting area of the suite ensured real comfort. Everything is spotless and the lounge so welcoming on a cool evening. And the food is just splendid. The staff could not have been more helpful or more friendly. We will certainly be back and have already recommended the hotel to friends who found it every bit as pleasant as we did.
reviews.title: A quality stay

reviews.text: My husband and I visited this wonderful place for my nephews wedding yesterday and from the moment we arrived to moment we left today our stay was absolutely outstanding.
reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding

reviews.text: The Gibbon Bridge rooms was out of this world (especially the whirlpool bath )oh what a joy when you have enjoyed the night before.
reviews.title: Wonderful wedding venue.

reviews.text: The staff was pleasent,attentive and overall 5 star service the food was very good and well presented, all in all was value for money.
reviews.title: Great Family Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definately be staying again in the future.
reviews.title: Pretty good - but.

reviews.text: Second visit to this quality hotel to witness and celebrate a wedding.
reviews.title: Delightful staff, lovely setting but .......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a wedding party in the summer. For the amount we paid we thought the rooms were tired and dated. Aside from the Receptionist who was very pleasant the rest of the staff lacked customer service skills.
reviews.title: Lacking Hospitality.

reviews.text: However our main gripe was that even as residents we were herded out of the function room at 12.30am and told in no uncertain terms that it was bedtime. I kid you not, there was not a room left open on the ground floor, in fact in the words of a staff member it was “lock down” time! We still had wine left in a bottle, and asked if we could simply sit as a quiet foursome chatting and finishing the wine off. We were bluntly told that the only place we could do this was in our rooms. And so it was that four fifty something’s (along with the rest of the guests staying overnight) were packed off to bed like naught school children. We found it quite amazing and seriously lacking in customer service.
reviews.title: Not quite a funky gibbon...

reviews.text: The upside of the hotel was that the food was wonderful, and the setting lovely. The gardens are stunning and are I Assume the main reason one would choose the hotel for a wedding. However, it is not somewhere I would even consider booing for my own daughter’s wedding due to the lack of welcome and below par accommodation we received. Hotel residents; also known as paying guests (!) should not be herded into the hallway and packed off to bed just so that the staff can get away it is unprofessional and reveals a real lack of understanding of the word hospitality, which is after all the business they are in.
reviews.title: Another excellent stay at The Gibbon Bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel - clean, good quality furnishing, fixtures and fittings. The location is good for exploring the beautiful Trough of Bowland
reviews.title: Digital downtime at our autumn hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - large, clean and comfortable with tasty biscuits, good hairdryer and comfy bed. The shower was a bit drippy and towels felt a bit old.
reviews.title: "A Lancashire Gem"

description: Four star award winning country hotel with beautiful gardens set amongst the rolling fells and farmland of the Ribble Valley. Breakfast is included within the price and there is ample secure car parking. The restaurant provides fresh locally sourced dishes daily.
